summary: [Row Spanning] Allow the rowspans not to disappear when using row spanning and the rowspan > rowBuffer, and scrolling beyond the rowBuffer
moreInformation:
This was implemented in the updated row spanning feature in v33.1. Please upgrade to this version and use the new row spanning feature which includes this requirement.
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/row-spanning/

If using an older version of AG Grid, you can workaround this issue by setting the gridOptions rowBuffer property to a larger value to pre-render more rows to allow the row span to render correctly. The rowBuffer property is documented here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/grid-options/#reference-miscellaneous-rowBuffer

By default rowBuffer is 20, so if you have row spans with more than 20 rows, that will cause the issue. 

You can fix this by setting the rowBuffer property to a value equal or bigger than the number of rows in the largest row span you have. For example, so if your biggest row span is 100 rows, set rowBuffer to 100 to resolve this as shown here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/LQnxgxum7Md2TWIp

Note that in this example the row span is correctly shown as you scroll down.

Please keep in mind that using a larger value for rowBuffer will increase the memory footprint, as it pre-renders a larger number of rows before they're scrolled into view.

breakingChangesNotes:
The types for the grid options `getMainMenuItems` and `getContextMenuItems`, as well as the column definition properties `mainMenuItems` and `contextMenuItems`, have changed. Instead of `string` values in the arrays (and in `defaultItems` in the callback`), this is now typed to `DefaultMenuItem` which only allows the available values.

The type for the grid option `chartMenuItems` has changed. Instead of `string` values in the array (and in `defaultItems` in the callback`), this is now typed to `ChartDefaultMenuItem` which only allows the available values.

[Theming] Allow providing separate icons for cases where icons are shared across multiple UI elements of the grid
breakingChangesNotes:
Setting any of the custom icons below will have the provided custom icon only apply in the 1 use case its name indicates instead of all cases as before. In order to have the custom icon apply to the remaining cases please set the additional icon keys pointing to the same custom icon. See list of icons changed:

smallDown (deprecated) - advancedFilterBuilderSelect for Advanced Filter Builder dropdown, selectOpen for Select cell editor and dropdowns (e.g. Integrated Charts menu), richSelectOpen for Rich Select cell editor.

smallLeft (deprecated) - panelDelimiterRtl for Row Group Panel / Pivot Panel, subMenuOpenRtl for sub-menus.

smallRight (deprecated) - panelDelimiter for Row Group Panel / Pivot Panel, subMenuOpen for sub-menus.

previous - previous for pagination, chartsThemePrevious for Integrated Charts theme picker.

next - next for pagination, chartsThemeNext for Integrated Charts theme picker.

cancel - cancel for column drag pills, richSelectRemove for Rich Select cell editor pills.

menu - menu for button to launch legacy column menu, legacyMenu for legacy column menu tab header.

menuAlt - menuAlt for new column menu, chartsMenu for Integrated Charts menu.

columns - columns for the column menu/column chooser, columnsToolPanel for the Columns Tool Panel tab icon.

filter - filter for buttons that open the filter (header/menu), filtersToolPanel for the Filters Tool Panel tab icon, filterActive for displaying the filter is active (header with legacy column menu, Filters Tool Panel item), filterTab for the filter tab of the legacy tabbed column menu.

save - save for export menu, chartsDownload for Integrated Charts download.

columnSelectClosed - columnSelectClosed for the Columns Tool Panel/Column Chooser/column tab in legacy tabbed column menu, accordionClosed for accordions (Filters Tool Panel, Integrated Charts tool panels).

columnSelectOpen - columnSelectOpen for the Columns Tool Panel/Column Chooser/column tab in legacy tabbed column menu, accordionOpen for accordions (Filters Tool Panel, Integrated Charts tool panels).

columnSelectIndeterminate - columnSelectIndeterminate for the Columns Tool Panel/Column Chooser/column tab in legacy tabbed column menu, accordionIndeterminate for accordions (Filters Tool Panel, Integrated Charts tool panels).See comments

summary: [API] Deprecate row node properties firstChild, lastChild and childIndex and corresponding events
deprecationNotes:
Row node properties:
`firstChild` - deprecated. Use `rowNode.parent?.childrenAfterSort?.[0] === rowNode` instead.
`lastChild` - deprecated. Use `!!rowNode.parent?.childrenAfterSort && (rowNode.parent.childrenAfterSort[rowNode.parent.childrenAfterSort.length - 1] === rowNode)` instead.
`childIndex` - deprecated. Use `rowNode.parent?.childrenAfterSort?.findIndex(r => r === rowNode)` instead.

Row node events:
`firstChildChanged` - deprecated. Use global `modelUpdated` event to determine when row children have changed.
`lastChildChanged` - deprecated. Use global `modelUpdated` event to determine when row children have changed.
`childIndexChanged` - deprecated. Use global `modelUpdated` event to determine when row children have changed.

deprecationNotes: suppressPropertyNamesCheck - deprecated without replacement. This property was previously used as a way to allow adding user properties storing user metadata in `gridOptions` and `columnDefs`. However, now that both have a `context` property that should be used to store arbitrary user metadata. This means that column definitions and gridOptions should only contain valid properties making this property redundant.

suppressRowGroupHidesColumns - deprecated, use suppressGroupChangesColumnVisibility: "suppressHideOnGroup" instead.
When setting both suppressMakeColumnVisibleAfterUnGroup and suppressRowGroupHidesColumns to true, use suppressGroupChangesColumnVisibility: true instead.

summary: [API] Make `suppressAggFuncInHeader` reactive
[Website] Add validation/error pages that can be linked from the grid library
[State] Allow the grid state to save the selectionColumnDef sorting state
[Bundle Size] Modularise the grid core module - create separate modules containing feature-specific code
deprecationNotes:
`ModuleRegistry.register(module)` is deprecated. Use `ModuleRegistry.registerModules([module])` instead.

`MenuModule` is deprecated. Use `ColumnMenuModule` for the Column Menu and/or `ContextMenuModule` for the Context Menu instead.

`RangeSelectionModule` is deprecated. Use `CellSelectionModule` instead.
breakingChangesNotes:
`api.getRowDropZoneParams()` can now return `undefined` if the `RowDragModule` is not registered.

Floating filters provided via the `colDef.filter` values `text`, `number`, `date`, `set`, `multi` and `group` no longer work. Use the values `agTextColumnFilter`, `agNumberColumnFilter`, `agDateColumnFilter`, `agSetColumnFilter`, `agMultiColumnFilter` and `agGroupColumnFilter` instead.

Column state properties in the column definition are no longer parsed to number/boolean. Provide the correct types instead of strings.

summary: [Sparklines] Update Sparklines to use grid tooltips (to avoid custom tooltips clipped at the bottom of the grid)
[Row Selection] Allow deselecting rows by clicking on them without need for CTRL/COMMAND
Column flex treats values 0 and less than 1 incorrectly according to CSS flexbox specification
breakingChangesNotes:
The `flex` coldef property now follows the CSS flexbox spec more closely, resulting in two breaking changes:

1. `flex: 0` will now result in a minimum width column (previously it was treated the same as `undefined` and disabled flexing). If you are using `0` to disable flex, use `undefined` instead.
2. `flex: 0.5` will now result in the column filling at most half of the available space (previously flex values greater than 0 and less than 1 were not treated specially and would fill all available space). If you want to always fill the available space, ensure that all flex values are 1 or greater.

summary: [Column Menu] Allow getMainMenuItems to be called when right-clicking group column header cells, pivot groups column cells and empty header space
breakingChangesNotes: The `column` property is now optional in the callback to get column menu items (in the grid option `getMainMenuItems` or `colDef.mainMenuItems`). `column` will be `null` when a column group header or empty column space is right-click on. A new property `columnGroup` will be provided when a column group header is right-clicked on.

summary: [Row Selection] Allow row selection API (node.setSelected and gridApi.setNodesSelected) methods to select grid rows which aren't selectable
Remove AG Grid global browser stubbing in server side environments
breakingChangesNotes: AG Grid no longer patches global properties that are not present in a Server environment, i.e HTMLElement and others. If possible you should avoid rendering AG Grid on the server as this is not supported.

tabToNextCell - null input param type deprecated, provide boolean input param type instead.
tabToNextHeaderCell - null input param type deprecated, provide boolean input param type instead.

Returning `null` from tabToNextCell is deprecated. Instead, return `true` to stay on the current cell, or `false` to let the browser handle the tab behaviour.
Returning `null` from tabToNextHeader is deprecated. Instead, return `true` to stay on the current header, or `false` to let the browser handle the tab behaviour.

summary: Allow adding a sticky/pinned grand total row at the top/bottom of the grid

You can display a total footer row like this (unpinned):
https://plnkr.co/edit/rCk57rcMmJX6uIVb?open=main.js

You can display a total header row that's sticky at the top (without row grouping):
https://plnkr.co/edit/8GAxCbSpkx6L9i19?open=main.js

You can display an emulated total header row that's sticky at the top (with row grouping):
https://plnkr.co/edit/1NQZjjHAUHVgPvcg?open=main.js

summary: [Interfaces] Setup column interfaces to only expose public methods
breakingChangesNotes:
`Column`, `ColumnGroup` and `ProvidedColumnGroup` are now interfaces instead of classes. Some public methods that were part of the internal grid API were previously exposed on the classes, but are not exposed on the interfaces.

The `IProvidedColumn` interface has been removed in favour of `Column | ProvidedColumnGroup`. The `IHeaderColumn` interfaces has been removed in favour of `Column | ColumnGroup`. If previously using `instanceof` to differentiate, it is now possible to check the `isColumn` property, which can be used as a type differentiator.

summary: When editing a cell, opening the context menu and pressing ESC key loses focus
[Cell Renderer] When toggling cell renderer checkboxes in filter tools panel a flicker can be observed
Allow Algolia search returns matches for text shown in docs pages
[Docs] Clarify how to find out whether a tree data node has child rows (use node.hasChildren() instead of node.group)
moreInformation:
Instead of node.group, please use the node.hasChildren() method to find out whether a row has child rows.
 
See this example showing 2 grid columns with values for node.group and node.hasChildren() for each row:
https://plnkr.co/edit/L6OxCS2QPKB5nyoy?open=index.jsx

Note the HAS CHILDREN cell values indicate which rows which have children.

UPDATE since v32 - Previously, rowNode.group was always false for tree data nodes, whether or not they had child nodes. This was an inconsistency between tree data and normal row grouping. This has now been made consistent: the value of .group for tree data nodes with children is true.

sortIndex applies incorrectly to group column
[Column Menu] When a checkbox is present in a narrow column header the column menu overlaps into the neighbouring border
moreInformation:
The issue here is that a min width that is smaller than what is required to display the header contents has been specified.
If you turn off the min width, the grid will prevent you from resizing the column that small.
So the correct solution here is to set a usable min width, or to disable the menu for that column.

[React] Deprecate legacy React interfaces
deprecationNotes:
`AgReactUiProps` is deprecated, use `AgGridReactProps` instead.
The properties `AgGridReactProps.disableStaticMarkup` and `AgGridReactProps.legacyComponentRendering` are deprecated, as these are no longer used.
The following React custom component interfaces are deprecated along with their methods `getReactContainerStyle` and `getReactContainerClasses` (apply styling directly to the CSS class `.ag-react-container` if needed) - `IHeaderGroupReactComp` (use `IHeaderGroup` instead), `IHeaderReactComp` (use `IHeader` instead), `IDateReactComp` (use `IDate` instead), `IFilterReactComp` (use `IFilter` instead), `IFloatingFilterReactComp` (use `IFloatingFilter` instead), `ICellRendererReactComp` (use `ICellRenderer` instead), `ICellEditorReactComp` (use `ICellEditor` instead), `ILoadingCellRendererReactComp` (no interface needed), `ILoadingOverlayReactComp` (use `ILoadingOverlay` instead), `INoRowsOverlayReactComp` (use `INoRowsOverlay` instead), `IStatusPanelReactComp` (use `IStatusPanel` instead), `IToolPanelReactComp` (use `IToolPanel` instead),  and `ITooltipReactComp` (no interface needed).

deprecationNotes:
gridApi.getModel() method is now deprecated. Instead, please use the corresponding methods on the gridApi:
IRowModel.getRow(index) → api.getDisplayedRowAtIndex(index)
IRowModel.getRowNode(id) → api.getRowNode(id)
IRowModel.getRowCount() → api.getDisplayedRowCount()
IRowModel.isEmpty() → !!api.getDisplayedRowCount()
IRowModel.forEachNode() → api.forEachNode()

api.getFirstDisplayedRow  → api.getFirstDisplayedRowIndex 
api.getLastDisplayedRow  → api.getLastDisplayedRowIndex

summary: [Column Menu] Update column menu UI to display a flat menu with sub-menus instead of tabs
moreInformation:
We have implemented a new flat menu which doesn't use tabs. 

However, we want to avoid displaying the filter and column chooser as submenus because clicking in a submenu needs to close the submenu, while both the filter and column chooser may require multiple clicks. 
Instead, in the new column menu:
1/ the filter popup is opened directly by clicking a button in the column header, separately from the column menu. This allows resizing the dialog to display longer items.
2/ the column chooser is opened from the column menu but is rendered in a dialog to allow resizing the dialog to display longer items.

summary: [Regression] When using Firefox, the vertical scrollbar partially covers the right-most column cells
moreInformation:
This isn't an issue in AG Grid but is instead due to the way invisible scrollbars work in Firefox. This issue is present with any scrollable container in Firefox because of this - see this shown here. Note the scrollbar is displayed on the inside of this container potentially covering up content.
https://plnkr.co/edit/ERNNaMY75kJ7RXR5?open=lib%2Fscript.js&preview

Chrome shows the scrollbars by default and this allows the grid to size itself accordingly to ensure no cell values are covered by the scrollbar. 

However, in Firefox the scrollbars respect the OS setting whether to always show scrollbars. If this setting isn't ON, Firefox will only show scrollbars when hovered causing this rendering issue. As scrollbars aren't shown by default, the grid renders itself over the entire area and the scrollbars are later shown over the grid content.

You can avoid this issue by configuring your OS to always show scrollbars. In Windows there's a setting "Always show scrollbars" which when set to true resolves this issue in Firefox.

[API] Removal of v28 deprecations in v31 release
breakingChangesNotes:
Column Api

 - getAllColumns: Use `api.getColumns`
 - getPrimaryColumns: Use `api.getColumns`
 - getSecondaryColumns: Use `api.getPivotResultColumns`
 - setSecondaryColumns: Use `api.setPivotResultColumns`
 - getSecondaryPivotColumn: Use `api.getPivotResultColumn`

Grid API

- refreshServerSideStore: Use `refreshServerSide`
- getServerSideStoreState: use `getServerSideGroupLevelState`
- setProcessSecondaryColDef: Use `api.setGridOption('processPivotResultColGroupDef', newValue)` 
- setProcessSecondaryColGroupDef: Use `api.setGridOption('setProcessPivotResultColGroupDef', newValue)`
- setGetServerSideStoreParams: Use `api.setGridOption('getServerSideGroupLevelParams', newValue)``

GridOptions

- serverSideStoreType: removed in favour of suppressServerSideInfiniteScroll. When false, Partial Store is used. When true, Full Store is used.
- serverSideSortingAlwaysResets: Use `serverSideSortAllLevels`
- serverSideFilteringAlwaysResets: Use `serverSideOnlyRefreshFilteredGroups`
- processSecondaryColDef: Use `processPivotResultColDef`
- processSecondaryColGroupDef: Use `processPivotResultColGroupDef`
- getServerSideStoreParams: Use `getServerSideGroupLevelParams`
- onRowDataChanged: No longer fired, use `onRowDataUpdated`

SSRM Interfaces 


- ServerSideGroupLevelParams.storeType: removed in favour of suppressInfiniteScroll. When false, Partial Store is used. When true, Full Store is used.
- IsApplyServerSideTransactionParams.storeInfo: use IsApplyServerSideTransactionParams.groupLevelInfo instead
- LoadSuccessParams.storeInfo: Use LoadSuccessParams.groupLevelInfo instead
- IServerSideGetRowsParams.successCallback: Use `success` method instead with `LoadSuccessParams` params
- IServerSideGetRowsParams.failCallback: Use `fail` instead.


- interface ServerSideStoreParams: Use ServerSideGroupLevelParams
- interface GetServerSideStoreParamsParams: Use GetServerSideGroupLevelParamsParams
- interface RefreshStoreParams: Use RefreshServerSideParams
- interface ServerSideGroupState: Use ServerSideGroupLevelState

ExportParams 

- columnGroups: groups are exported by default.
- skipGroups: Use `skipRowGroups`
- skipHeader: Use `skipColumnHeaders`
- customFooter: Use `appendContent`
- customHeader: Use `prependContent`


- interfaces RangeSelection: Use CellRange
- interface AddRangeSelectionParams: Use CellRangeParams

React 

- rowDataChangeDetectionStrategy: Identity / reference equals always used

summary: [Events] When multiple grids are initialised with the same gridOptions object, the last grid events override the events of other grids
[SSRM] When rowSelection='multiple', purging the cache does not clear row selection
moreInformation:
The purging works on a per-level basis. If we make this change, the purge of a particular level should clear the selection on that level only and not the rest of the selection in other levels. This is quite inconsistent and difficult to reason about.

The purge of rows should be separate from row selection, so if the previously selected rows get reloaded after the purge, they’re still selected.

This is why row selection shouldn't be cleared as part of the purge process. The developer should clear row selection manually via API call.

summary: [State] Allow getting/setting (saving/restoring) horizontal/vertical scroll positions
moreInformation:
In AG Grid v31 and later you can use grid state to achieve this.

In previous versions, you can implement this by saving/restoring the vertical and horizontal scroll positions using internal API members (subject to change in later versions):
1. Open
Example (JS): https://plnkr.co/edit/STPMHNk8wW2gl6S4 
Example (Angular): https://plnkr.co/edit/QrDOQiw4Zs2OuW11
2. Scroll the grid down
3. Scroll the grid right
4. Refresh the plunker preview using the small refresh button in the plunker preview pane (not the entire browser window)
Actual & Expected: Grid reloads, earlier scrollbar positions restored


Note in this sample the scroll position gets saved to local storage inside the onBodyScroll event handler. Also, onBodyScroll event handler gets called when the grid first initializes so we ignore the first call. The scroll positions get restored inside the firstDataRendered event handler which gets fired when the grid is rendered for the first time.

summary: [Row Grouping] Allow keeping the row groups/pivot columns value original type instead of converting it to string to support grouping by complex objects
moreInformation:
In the meantime, to sort non-string values consistently when grouping and not grouping, define a comparator on the columnDef which parses the type of the value:
1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/QLAE81VdKMKXzd16?open=main.js
2. Note order of rows
Actual & Expected: AGE values sorted as numbers (1,2,10,11)
3. Open the column menu, group by AGE column
4. Note order of row groups
Actual: Row group values sorted as strings (1,10,11,2)
Expected: Row group values sorted as numbers (1,2,10,11)

To sort non-string values consistently when pivoting, define a pivotComparator on the columnDef which parses the type of the value:
https://plnkr.co/edit/y6xZREq93X30T1c8?open=main.js
Pivot by AGE column and note the values are sorted numerically due to the pivotComparator.
breakingChangesNotes:
Group values will no longer be typeless, and will be inferred from the first row when they were created.

When using row grouping with groupDisplayType='singleColumn' (which is the default behavior) and displaying checkboxes in the auto-group column, checkboxes in leaf rows are only displayed if autoGroupColumnDef provides a field or a valueGetter to show values in leaf row cells. If you'd like to show checkboxes in the group columns for leaf rows, provide a field or valueGetter in the autoGroupColumnDef.

summary: [Row Grouping] Allow preventing ungrouping and reordering columns in row group panel on a per-column basis
[React] Make chart series label properties reactive
[Column Pinning] Allow automatically unpinning/preventing the pinning of grid columns when total pinned width exceeds grid width
moreInformation:
The pinned area cannot be made scrollable at this time but you can prevent the pinned columns area from becoming too wide by adding user logic to resize columns when pinned. This way you can ensure the pinned column area doesn't cover the entire grid width and that you can still access the unpinned columns. 

See this sample: 
https://plnkr.co/edit/TsxyiRuOcGAutQIp

In this example, pin multiple columns on the left and note they are resized down so there's always enough space left to display the unpinned columns.

Since v31, pinned columns are unpinned automatically when there's not enough space left to show unpinned columns. This behavior can be disabled by returning an empty array in the processUnpinnedColumns callback:
https://ag-grid.com/angular-data-grid/grid-options/#reference--processUnpinnedColumns

If you want to prevent columns with colDef.lockPinned from getting automatically unpinned, please do not return them in the processUnpinnedColumns as shown in example below - instead return pinned columns which don't have colDef.lockPinned=true:
https://plnkr.co/edit/p3AJlvC2FcefLKGT?open=main.js&preview

summary: [React] Make gridOptions.groupHideOpenParent property reactive

summary: [State] Allow save/restore of initial grid state as a single object
moreInformation:
After setting the Column Definitions and initializing the AGGrid instance, the grid is briefly rendered with columns in the wrong position or with incorrect widths, before the saved column state is applied (via call to applyColumnState(...)). 

By setting gridOptions.suppressColumnMoveAnimation = true; before instantiating the agGrid instance and re-enabling it again after the call to .applyColumnState(...), on the 1st render of the grid the columns are immediately rendered with the correct width and in the correct position according to the applied columnState.
breakingChangesNotes: In order to apply initial state to the grid, columns need to be loaded. This is why until columnDefs are provided, a loading overlay will be displayed until column definitions are set. To go back to the earlier behavior of showing a grid without any columns (when not setting columnDefs), please set columnDefs=[] explicitly.

summary: When useValueFormatterForExport=true, exporting to Excel doesn't export the formatted value
moreInformation:
This is actually expected behavior as documented here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/value-formatters/#use-value-formatter-for-export
 
Please scroll to the bottom of the page and note the last condition - "If the underlying value is a number when using Excel export, the valueFormatter logic is ignored by default".
 
This is because formatting a number when exporting it exports this as a string to Excel, and thus prevents the use of this cell in formulas. If we format number values when exporting to Excel, we'd prevent users from using these numbers in formulas.
 
Numeric grid cell values are exported as number and you'll need to format these values in Excel.

[Columns] When removing a pivot/row group/aggregation the wrong column is provided to the onColumnRowGroupChanged, onColumnValueChanged, onColumnPivotChanged
moreInformation:
We're changing the `columns` and `column` props of the params of onColumnRowGroupChanged, onColumnValueChanged and onColumnPivotChanged as well as when they are fired.

Specifically, previously the  `columns` and `column` props of the params object included the full list columns grouped/aggregated/pivoted. After the update they only include the changed columns (added/removed/reordered), which may not be provided in the order in which they are grouped/value/pivoted. 

In order to get the grouped/value/pivoted columns, use api.getRowGroupColumns/getValueColumns/getPivotColumns methods instead.

The `CellKeyPress` and `FullWidthCellKeyPress` events are no longer fired by the Grid. These events have been replaced by `CellKeyDown` and `FullWidthCellKeyDown`.

All events that source `spacePressed` and `deleteKeyPressed` now have the source as `spaceKey` and `deleteKey`.

charPress was also removed from ICellEditorParams and StartEditingCellParams. You can now detect a key press by using:
if (eventKey.length === 1)

[API] Removal of v27 deprecations in v30 release
breakingChangesNotes:
Breaking Changes:

Angular Upgrade

  • The minimum Angular dependency supported by AG Grid v30 is now Angular v12. Previous versions of Angular aren't supported by AG Grid v30.
  • There is no v30 for @ag-grid-community/angular-legacy or ag-grid-angular-legacy as these are only required for Angular versions <= v11
  • See Angular Compatibility for more information.

ColDef

The following properties were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

Cell Rendering

  • cellRendererFramework - removed, use cellRenderer instead.
  • Return type of cellRendererSelector property frameworkComponent removed - use component instead.

Cell Editing

  • cellEditorFramework - removed, use cellEditor instead.
  • Return type of cellEditorSelector property frameworkComponent removed - use component instead.
  • 'agPopupTextCellEditor' removed - use {cellEditor: \"agTextCellEditor\"; cellEditorPopup: true} instead.
  • 'agPopupSelectCellEditor' removed - use {cellEditor: \"agSelectCellEditor\"; cellEditorPopup: true} instead.

Components

  • tooltipComponentFramework - removed, use tooltipComponent instead.
  • headerComponentFramework - removed, use headerComponent instead.
  • headerGroupComponentFramework - removed, use headerGroupComponent instead.

ColumnGroup

The following properties were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

  • getOriginalColumnGroup - removed, use getProvidedColumnGroup instead.

Column Api

The following methods were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

  • getOriginalColumnGroup - removed, use getProvidedColumnGroup instead.

GridOptions

The following properties were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

Clipboard

  • clipboardDeliminator - removed, use clipboardDelimiter instead.

Components

  • frameworkComponents - removed, use components instead.
  • loadingCellRendererFramework - removed, use loadingCellRenderer instead.
  • Return type of loadingCellRendererSelector property frameworkComponent removed - use component instead.
  • detailCellRendererFramework - removed, use detailCellRenderer instead.
  • loadingOverlayComponentFramework - removed, use loadingOverlayComponent instead.
  • noRowsOverlayComponentFramework - removed, use noRowsOverlayComponent instead.
  • fullWidthCellRendererFramework - removed, use fullWidthCellRenderer instead.
  • groupRowRendererFramework - removed, use groupRowRenderer instead.

Editing

  • stopEditingWhenGridLosesFocus - removed, use stopEditingWhenCellsLoseFocus instead.

Full Width

  • isFullWidthCell - removed, use isFullWidthRow instead.

Grouping

  • groupMultiAutoColumn - removed, set groupDisplayType='multipleColumns' instead.
  • groupUseEntireRow - removed, set groupDisplayType='groupRows' instead.
  • defaultGroupOrderComparator - removed, use initialGroupOrderComparator instead.
  • groupRowAggNodes - removed, use getGroupRowAgg instead.

Immutable Data

  • immutableData - removed, implement getRowId() to enable immutable data mode.
  • getRowNodeId - removed, use getRowId() instead.

Localisation

  • localeTextFunc - removed, use getLocaleText instead.

Selection

  • suppressCellSelection - removed, use suppressCellFocus instead.

Sorting

  • postSort - removed, use postSortRows instead.

React

  • reactUI - removed as this is now the default.

Row Dragging

  • enableMultiRowDragging - removed, use rowDragMultiRow instead.

Grid API

The following methods were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

Full Width

  • setIsFullWidthCell - removed, use setIsFullWidthRow instead.

Grouping

  • setGroupRowAggNodes - removed, use setGetGroupRowAgg instead.
  • setDefaultGroupOrderComparator - removed, use setInitialGroupOrderComparator instead.

Immutable Data

  • setGetRowNodeId - removed, use setGetRowId instead.

Sorting

  • setPostSort - removed, use setPostSortRows instead.

IFilterOptionDef

  • test removed - use predicate instead.
  • hideFilterInput removed - use numberOfInputs: 0 instead.

ISetFilterParams

  • cellRendererFramework removed - use cellRenderer instead.

ToolPanelDef

  • toolPanelFramework removed - use toolPanel instead.

StatusPanelDef

  • statusPanelFramework removed - use statusPanel instead.

IGroupCellRendererParams

  • innerRendererFramework removed - use innerRenderer instead.

IMultiFilterDef

  • filterFramework removed - use filter instead.
  • floatingFilterComponentFramework removed - use floatingFilterComponent instead.

summary: [Cell Editing] Add cell data types and cell data type inference
breakingChangesNotes:
Cell data type inference is active by default. 

This means that by default grid columns with boolean values will display checkboxes representing the boolean values. The valueFormatter set on the column definition will be run, but its result will be ignored and the unformatted value will be used for the checkbox shown in the cell. 

You can disable this behavior for specific columns and show the formatted boolean value as text by setting colDef.cellDataType=false.

breakingChangesNotes: The `toolPanelVisibleChanged` event has been updated (https://ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/tool-panel/#reference-accessories-toolPanelVisibleChanged). It now fires twice when switching between panels (once for the old panel and once for the new panel), but has new fields to indicate the change. The source property now refers to the event source rather than the panel name.

summary: [Row Grouping] Allow group selection without checkboxes
moreInformation:
This feature won’t be implemented.

The only way to select group rows is via checkbox selection. This is because the mouse click (double-click) is used for expanding / contracting the group, so if this is in place, double-clicking a group header would toggle the expansion and the selection at the same time.

[Column Filters] When using set filter with excelMode=windows/mac and defaultToNothingSelected=true, selecting all items doesn't allow de-selecting items
moreInformation:
We've done additional research into the way the set filter works. We've concluded that the defaultToNothingSelected property shouldn't apply to set filter Excel mode as this goes against the way Excel filtering works. The set filter Excel mode is built to follow the way filtering works in Excel. Setting the defaultToNothingSelected property modified the default Excel filtering behavior and cannot be supported by the set filter excel mode as it goes against one of its main features - that opening the filter all options are selected. 

End users expect the filter to work just like in Excel and making these modifications creates a non-standard filtering experience. This modified filtering UI is harder for users to work with because it behaves in a way that's different from Excel. This is why we're closing this bug as rejected.
 
The defaultToNothingSelected property still applies to the normal filtering mode, when not using set filter Excel mode. 
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/filter-set/#enabling-set-filters
 
This is why, if you'd like to use set filter Excel mode, please remove the setting of defaultToNothingSelected in your set filters configuration.

When using Chrome 112 on Mac, horizontal scrolling using the trackpad causes headers to scroll slower than grid viewport
moreInformation:
This behavior is due to a change in Chrome which makes asynchronous scrolling default behavior. They had the same issue in Chrome v108 last year which was resolved in v111 by making async scrolling optional. 
 
This issue was reintroduced in Chrome v112 because they've once again made async scrolling default once again.
 
This scrolling lag is due to Chrome reintroducing async scroll by default in Chrome 112. In order to resolve this, please follow the steps below:
1. Open Chrome
2. Open page
chrome://flags
3. Look up “Scroll Unification” 
4. Set “Scroll Unification” to DISABLED

summary: [Layout & Styling] Remove deprecated themes ag-theme-bootstrap, ag-theme-dark, ag-theme-blue and ag-theme-fresh from grid
breakingChangesNotes:
The ag-theme-dark, ag-theme-bootstrap, ag-theme-fresh and ag-theme-blue themes are removed because they are using legacy stylesheets which aren't supported by the new theming mechanism introduced in AG-6370.

You can rebuild these themes using the new theming mechanism by overriding Sass variables as shown here:
https://github.com/ag-grid/ag-grid-customise-theme

You can modify the balham theme to look like the fresh theme like this:
https://plnkr.co/edit/SFMFkg1nvCSpXJax?open=main.js

You can modify the balham theme to look like the blue theme like this:
https://plnkr.co/edit/ei5ngTH1CslUT94x?open=main.js&preview

summary: [Scrolling] Allow column headers to scroll without a delay from the grid viewport in Safari and Firefox on MacOS/iOS
moreInformation:
You can work around this issue for Safari and Firefox on Mac by setting gridOptions.suppressColumnVirtualisation=true
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/grid-options/#reference-rendering-suppressColumnVirtualisation

This issue is due to a browser module called APZ:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/GFX/APZ
 
Safari and Firefox have now APZ enabled by default. Chrome enabled APZ by default in v108 and then reverted it back because of the many issues it was causing for website owners. 
 
Currently there's no way to avoid this issue because browsers don't provide an API to disable APZ for some elements so there'll be no de-synchronization. There will only be a solution once W3C comes up with a standard way to disable APZ for specific elements that all browsers apply.

As this isn't an AG Grid issue but a browser behavior, we have closed this as rejected.

[Layout & Styling] Remove deprecated legacy SASS styles
breakingChangesNotes:
In AG Grid v28, we have ported our grid layout system to use CSS variables. AG Grid v27 and earlier used SASS. In order to ease the upgrade to AG Grid v28, we have continued to include the legacy Sass API and CSS stylesheets at their old file paths. 

However, in AG Grid v29 SASS is now removed and you need to change the import paths for CSS and Sass (.scss) files. The v27 import paths are now invalid in v29 and the themes won't work.

Please see more here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/global-style-upgrading-to-v28/

breakingChangesNotes:
Column

The following Column methods were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

  • isLockPosition() - removed, use col.getColDef().lockPosition instead.
  • isLockVisible() - removed, use col.getColDef().lockVisible instead.
  • isLockPinned() - removed, use col.getColDef().lockPinned instead.

summary: [API] Remove the deprecated defaultGroupComparator API member
breakingChangesNotes: The deprecated defaultGroupComparator has been removed as it is not necessary. Please remove this from your colDef.

summary: When pivot result column is hidden, changing grouped columns throws exceptions
[React] Remove React ChangeDetectionStrategyType.DeepValueCheck
deprecationNotes: As the `DeepValueCheck` change detection strategy has been removed the `rowDataChangeDetectionStrategy` has now been deprecated as it no longer supports a different strategy then the default reference equals comparison.
breakingChangesNotes:
In previous versions of AG Grid, we introduced a `DeepValueCheck` change detection strategy that performed an additional deep value comparison above and beyond reference equality. This was to help React users who were unintentionally setting their `rowData` prop when the row data had not actually changed. This resulted in additional grid re-renders as the grid reapplies the rows despite there being no real change. 

However, the DeepValueCheck introduced a number of issues, as well as introducing an additional cost for users who correctly manage their grid state. i.e only updating the `rowData` prop when there are real data changes.

When correctly using Hooks, i.e setState and dependency arrays, `DeepValueCheck` is not required and so it has been removed to avoid the issues described above. If you now see additional re-renders please check that you are only updating grid state properties when they have actually changed. See https://ag-grid.com/react-data-grid/react-hooks/ for more information.

summary: [React v18] Calling columnApi.autoSizeColumns(false) within onFirstDataRendered incorrectly ignores header cell width

[Angular] Upgrade Legacy Project to Angular v10
breakingChangesNotes: The minimum Angular dependency supported by AG Grid v29 is now Angular v10 via legacy packages. Previous versions of Angular aren't supported by AG Grid v29.

summary: [API] Remove legacy deprecated properties from GridOptions and ColDefs
breakingChangesNotes:
ColDef

The following properties were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

  • newValueHandler() - removed, use valueSetter instead.
  • sortedAt - removed, use sortIndex instead.
  • pinnedRowCellRenderer - removed, use cellRendererSelector instead and use params.node.rowPinned to distinguish.
  • pinnedRowCellRendererFramework - removed, use cellRendererSelector instead and use params.node.rowPinned to distinguish.
  • pinnedRowCellRendererParams - removed, use cellRendererSelector instead and use params.node.rowPinned to distinguish.
  • pinnedRowValueFormatter - removed, use valueFormatter instead and use params.node.rowPinned to distinguish.

GridOptions

The following properties were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

Grouping

  • groupRowInnerRenderer - removed, use groupRowRendererParams.innerRenderer instead.
  • groupRowInnerRendererFramework - removed, use groupRowRendererParams.innerRenderer instead.
  • groupMultiAutoColumn - removed, use groupDisplayType = 'multipleColumns' instead.
  • groupUseEntireRow - removed, use groupDisplayType = 'groupRows' instead.
  • groupSuppressAutoColumn - removed, use groupDisplayType = 'custom' instead.
  • defaultGroupSortComparator - removed, use initialGroupOrderComparator instead.

Column State

  • deltaColumnMode, immutableColumns, applyColumnDefOrder - removed, the grid now works like this as default. To keep column order maintained, set grid property maintainColumnOrder=true.
  • suppressEnterpriseResetOnNewColumns - removed as no longer required.
  • suppressSetColumnStateEvents, suppressColumnStateEvents - removed, use event.source = "api" to identify events due to setting column state via the API.
  • colWidth - removed, use defaultColDef.width instead.
  • minColWidth - removed, use defaultColDef.minWidth instead.
  • maxColWidth - removed, use defaultColDef.maxWidth instead.

Full Width

  • deprecatedEmbedFullWidthRows - removed, use embedFullWidthRows instead.

Editing

  • stopEditingWhenGridLosesFocus - removed, use stopEditingWhenCellsLoseFocus instead.

Export

  • defaultExportParams - removed, use defaultCsvExportParams for CSV or defaultExcelExportParams for Excel exports instead.

Keyboard

  • suppressKeyboardEvent - removed, use colDef.suppressKeyboardEvent or for every column via defaultColDef.suppressKeyboardEvent.

Selection

  • rowDeselection - removed. Now true by default and should be suppressed by using suppressRowDeselection.

Updating Data

  • batchUpdateWaitMillis - removed, use asyncTransactionWaitMillis instead.
  • deltaRowDataMode - removed, use getRowId() callback to enable immutable data mode.

summary: [Integrated] Enable Chart Tool Panels Button by default
deprecationNotes: enableChartToolPanelsButton property is now deprecated because the chart is now showing the chart tool panels button by default.
breakingChangesNotes:
Integrated charts display the chart tool panels button by default instead of the toolbar hamburger button.

In order to display the toolbar hamburger button, please set suppressChartToolPanelsButton=true

summary: [Accessibility] Remove from the DOM unused row/column pinned containers and unused empty rows
[SSRM] Unexpected getRows request made when using row drag
[Regression] When using domLayout="autoHeight" and dragging a cell range to the right/left edges of the viewport, it doesn't scroll horizontally
When rowData=null the loading overlay is displayed but calling setRowData(null) displays the empty overlay instead
moreInformation:
The loading overlay is automatically displayed only when loading data at the time the grid is initialised. This initial loading state is the state of the grid when the rowData has never been touched. 

This is why, after the initial load, the grid no longer displays the loading overlay automatically. If you want to display the loading overlay, please call api.showLoadingOverlay(). It’s up to you if you want to erase the grid’s content before you display the overlay.

summary: [API] Remove deprecated ag-grid-column/AgGridColumn components
breakingChangesNotes:
AG Grid Column / AgGridColumn Components

The framework column components were previously deprecated and have now been removed. Define your column definitions in code via gridOptions.columnDefs or set directly on the AG Grid Component via the columnDefs property.

summary: When using group rows with empty keys, row rendering breaks
[SSRM] Add support for transactions when Infinite Scrolling is enabled
When using case-insensitive set filter, items with the same value but a different case are unchecked unnecessarily
[API] Introduce IRowNode to show the public facing interface instead of the internal object RowNode
moreInformation:
In previous versions of AG Grid the internal `RowNode` class was provided to users via the grid's interfaces. This meant it was possible to call methods / access properties that are only intended for internal use. Only propeties / methods listed on  https://ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/row-object/ should have been used.

To make this distinction clearer the `IRowNode` interface has been introduced which contains all the properties / methods that are officially supported. 

If you are using a property / method not available on `IRowNode` then a short-term workaround will be to cast to `RowNode`. If this is the case please also report this to us, explaining your use case for accessing an internal property.
breakingChangesNotes:
Typescript users may get type errors if accessing internal properties of `RowNode` following the introduction of `IRowNode`. 

Please resolve this by casting to `RowNode` or updating your code to use properties available on `IRowNode`.

summary: [Aggregations] Allow removing column aggregation function from the column menu
[Frameworks] Upgrade Typescript Version to 4.0.8
breakingChangesNotes: Minimum Typescript version is now 4.0

summary: [API] Remove legacy deprecated methods from gridApi and columnApi
breakingChangesNotes:
Column Api

The following methods were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

Column State

  • setState, setColumnState - removed, use applyColumnState instead.
  • getState - removed, use getColumnState instead.
  • resetState - removed, use resetColumnState instead.
  • hideColumn, hideColumns - removed, use setColumnVisible, setColumnsVisible instead.
  • columnGroupOpened - removed, use setColumnGroupOpened instead.

Aggregation

  • getAggregationColumns - removed, use getValueColumns instead.
  • addAggregationColumn, addAggregationColumns - removed, use addValueColumn, addValueColumns instead.
  • removeAggregationColumn, removeAggregationColumns - removed, use removeValueColumn, removeValueColumns instead.
  • resetState - removed, use resetColumnState instead.
  • setColumnAggFunction - removed, use setColumnAggFunc instead.

Display

  • getDisplayNameForCol - removed, use getDisplayNameForColumn instead.

Grid Api

The following methods were previously deprecated and have now been removed.

Pinned Rows

  • setFloatingTopRowData, setFloatingBottomRowData - removed, use setPinnedTopRowData, setPinnedBottomRowData instead.
  • getFloatingTopRowCount, getFloatingBottomRowCount - removed, use getPinnedTopRowCount, getPinnedBottomRowCount instead.
  • getFloatingTopRow, getFloatingBottomRow - removed, use getPinnedTopRow, getPinnedBottomRow instead.

Selection

  • selectIndex, deselectIndex - removed, use rowNode.setSelected(isSelected) instead.
  • selectNode, deselectNode - removed, use rowNode.setSelected(isSelected) instead.
  • getSelectedNodesById - removed, use getSelectedNodes instead.
  • isNodeSelected - removed, use rowNode.isSelected instead.
  • getRangeSelections - removed, use getCellRanges instead.
  • addRangeSelection - removed, use addCellRange instead.

Grouping

  • onGroupExpandedOrCollapsed(param) - method no longer accepts an optional parameter.

Display

  • ensureColIndexVisible - removed, use ensureColumnVisible instead.
  • doLayout - removed, no longer required as grid now responds to size changes.
  • checkGridSize - removed as was legacy and no longer required.
  • getFirstRenderedRow, getLastRenderedRow - removed, use getFirstDisplayedRow, getLastDisplayedRow instead.
  • addVirtualRowListener - removed, use addRenderedRowListener instead.

Client Side Row Model

  • refreshInMemoryRowModel - removed, use refreshClientSideRowModel(step) instead.
  • recomputeAggregates - removed, use refreshClientSideRowModel('aggregate') instead.
  • updateRowData - removed, use applyTransaction instead.
  • batchUpdateRowData, insertItemsAtIndex, addItems, removeItems - removed, use applyTransactionAsync instead.

Infinite Row Model

  • refreshVirtualPageCache, refreshInfinitePageCache - removed, use refreshInfiniteCache instead.
  • purgeVirtualPageCache, purgeInfinitePageCache - removed, use purgeInfiniteCache instead.
  • getVirtualRowCount - removed, use getInfiniteRowCount instead.
  • isMaxRowFound - removed, use isLastRowIndexKnown instead.
  • setVirtualRowCount, setInfiniteRowCount - removed, use setRowCount instead.
  • getVirtualPageState, getInfinitePageState - removed, use getCacheBlockState instead.

Server Side Row Model

  • setEnterpriseDatasource - removed, use setServerSideDatasource instead.
  • purgeEnterpriseCache, purgeServerSideCache - removed, use refreshServerSide({purge: true}) instead.

When setting multiple column filters, subsequently applied column filters update the number of unique values shown in the set filter UI, but don't update the set filter filterModel which still contains the original values when the set filter was applied
moreInformation:
The filterModel.<column-name> value count is the value count at the time the filter was applied. The value shown in the set filter input is reflects the current number of unique values in rows which are the result of further filtering in the grid.

This is why this isn't an issue.

summary: [Clipboard] Allow including the column header text just once before multiple cell range values in case all the copied cell ranges include exactly the same columns

[Row Grouping] Make unbalanced row groups an optional behavior
breakingChangesNotes:
Unbalanced groups have now been disabled by default.

Rows with empty/undefined/null values for the group column will now be grouped under a `(Blanks)` group unless unbalanced groups are explicitly enabled by setting groupAllowUnbalanced=true.

' ' (one singular space) is no longer treated as equivalent to null and undefined when pivoting. 

However, '' (empty string) now is treated as equivalent to null and undefined.

summary: [SSRM] Allow keeping the context menu popup open when calling api.refreshServerSide()
When setting set filter values and applying a filter model, column is not filtered
moreInformation:
This is expected behaviour in this situation where the same items are set in the filter values and also applied in the filter model.
When all values in a partial filter are selected, this is the equivalent of removing the filter and so the filter model is empty. This behaviour is essential, as it allows users to turn off a partial filter.
If there are more items set in the filter values than there are applied in filter model, the filter model is updated correctly.

https://plnkr.co/edit/KhTXWCzlnkJxgyH2?open=main.js 
2. Click button above grid
Actual & Expected: Leah Flowers row becomes a group row with a child row

summary: [Excel Export] Allow exporting row group footers (group subtotal rows and grand total row) to Excel/CSV
[Column Filters] Allow set filter to support complex objects as provided set filter values
deprecationNotes:
`filterParams.convertValuesToStrings = true` in the Column Definition is deprecated. This is a new setting to enable the legacy behaviour for converting values in the Set Filter to strings. Instead, handle the values with the correct/original type, including the processing of complex objects.

`ISetFilter.getValues()` is deprecated. Use `getFilterValues` to get the values in the Set Filter (e.g. complex objects if provided), or `getFilterKeys` to get the string keys.
breakingChangesNotes:
Set Filters now maintain the type of the values, instead of everything being converted to strings:
- Primitive types (e.g. number, boolean, etc.) are strings when used as keys in the Filter Model, but maintain their type otherwise (e.g. for Value Formatters, Comparators, etc.).
- Complex objects support separate keys and display values. Value Formatter is now mandatory. Supplied Values for the Filter List require the full complex object.
- Key Creator is applied after splitting arrays for Multiple Values with complex objects, rather than before.
The old behaviour of always converting all filter values to strings can be replicated by setting `filterParams.convertValuesToStrings = true` in the Column Definition.

summary: [Docs] Add a docs example to show adding new rows dynamically if needed to fit all the pasted rows
When sorting unbalanced groups, unbalanced nodes are incorrectly comparing to row groups
moreInformation:
We agree this is an inconsistency but at this time we will not be resolving this. Unbalanced groups requires special handling in terms of further sorting/filtering/etc. However, at this time we don't plan to modify this behavior.

In order to achieve a consistent UX in this use case set an empty string for the group column value (instead of null) so you're not using unbalanced groups. 

Please see this in the example below:

1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/MUfPUuSgopsA5Xwl?open=main.js
2. Click GROUP column header to sort
3. Expand SWIMMING row group
4. Press SHIFT key and click the COUNTRY column header to sort COUNTRY descending
Actual & Expected: Empty Country row groups sorted at the bottom when descending
5. Press SHIFT key and click the COUNTRY column header to sort COUNTRY ascending
Actual & Expected: Empty Country row groups sorted at the top when ascending

summary: When all grid rows are filtered out and no data is shown in the integrated chart, removing the filter doesn't display any points in the chart
moreInformation:
This can easily be solved by setting the chartDataType property in the column definition. This way the chart already knows this column contains data to be charted and charts it immediately instead of trying to infer it.
 
See below:
1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/7LWD8V546gN5bL1h?open=main.js
2. Open the DATE column filter
3. Uncheck the SELECT ALL checkbox
Actual & Expected: Grid shows no rows, chart empty and shows no points
4. Check SELECT ALL checkbox
Actual & Expected: Grid shows all rows, chart shows all points

Steps to illustrate:

5.Click the top row to clear the row selection
6. Holding the SHIFT key pressed, click the rows Michael Phelps, Missy Franklin
7. Click the button above the grid
Actual & Expected: Console contains an array of the selected rows in order - Michael Phelps, Natalie Coughlin, Aleksey Nemov, Alicia Coutts, Missy Franklin

summary: When readOnlyEdit=true, editing a grid cell causes flicker and lost focus
[SSRM] Simplify SSRM by removing Store concept
moreInformation:
Everyone found the SSRM terms Full Store and Partial Store confusing.

These were internal implementation details and should not have been exposed.

Instead we now have the concept of infiniteScroll=true/false. When it is true, we use the Partial Store. When it is false, we use the Full Store. However this is internal to the grid and is an implementation detail, the application only needs to be aware of the effect, which is one store supports Infinite Scroll where as the other does not.
deprecationNotes:
Grid property serverSideStoreType=full/partial is replaced with serverSideInfiniteScroll=true/false

Instead of serverSideStoreType='partial' use serverSideInfiniteScroll=true
Instead of serverSideStoreType='full' use serverSideInfiniteScroll=false

gridApi.getServerSideStoreParams(GetServerSideStoreParamsParams) 
replaced with
gridApi.getServerSideGroupLevelParams(GetServerSideGroupLevelParamsParams) 

gridApi.getServerSideStoreState()
replaced with
gridApi.getServerSideGroupLevelState()

gridApi.refreshServerSideStore()
replaced with
gridApi.refreshServerSide()

IsApplyServerSideTransactionParams.storeInfo
replaced with 
IsApplyServerSideTransactionParams.groupLevelInfo,

LoadSuccessParams.storeInfo
replaced with
LoadSuccessParams.groupLevelInfo

summary: When dragging the fill handle in a pinned column, the fill area dashed border isn't shown in the border between the pinned and unpinned columns

[SSRM] Allow Server-Side Sorting & Filtering when using server-side row model without Infinite Scroll
breakingChangesNotes:
Deprecated grid property serverSideSortingAlwaysResets. Please use the serverSideSortAllLevels property instead.
Deprecated grid property serverSideFilteringAlwaysResets. Please use the serverSideFilterAllLevels property instead.

The default behaviour of SSRM partial store filtering has changed. The old behaviour caused the grid to purge all rows from the root level on change. This has now been updated in line with the behaviour of sorting to selectively refresh only groups which could have been affected by the change in filters.
The old behaviour of always performing a reset is available by enabling the grid option `serverSideFilterAllLevels`.

When using SSRM with tree data, the default behaviour when filtering used to be refresh data from the server. The new default behaviour is to filter on the client side. The old behaviour can be recovered by enabling serverSideFilterAllLevels

Old: represented number of leaf rows in grid + header rows

summary: [Accessibility] Allow row group panel to use correct accessibility attribute (role instead of aria-role)
[Events] Remove rowDataChanged event in favor of rowDataUpdated event, and call filter.onNewRoadsLoaded consitently
moreInformation:
There was inconsistency in the events fired by the grid when applying transactions (calling applyTransaction API method) and setting row data (calling setRowData API method).

Previous behavior when adding new data:
1/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId callback missing): rowDataChanged fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
2/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId callback provided): rowDataUpdated fired, rowDataChanged fired
3/ Calling Apply Transaction: rowDataUpdated fired

With the changes made, the grid now never fires rowDataChanged (which is deprecated). Instead it fires rowDataUpdated in all occasions as well as filter.onNewRowsLoaded in all occasions.
1/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId missing): rowDataUpdated fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
2/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId provided): rowDataUpdated fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
3/ Calling Apply Transaction: rowDataUpdated fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
deprecationNotes: rowDataChanged event is now deprecated and no longer fired from the grid. Instead rowDataUpdated is fired in all scenarios where either rowDataChanged or rowDataUpdated event was previously fired.
breakingChangesNotes:
Previous behavior when adding new data in a filtered grid:
1/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId callback missing): rowDataChanged fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
2/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId callback provided): rowDataUpdated fired, rowDataChanged fired
3/ Calling Apply Transaction: rowDataUpdated fired

With the changes made, the grid now never fires rowDataChanged (which is deprecated). Instead it fires rowDataUpdated in all occasions as well as filter.onNewRowsLoaded in all occasions.
1/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId missing): rowDataUpdated fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
2/ Providing new RowData by calling setRowData (getRowId provided): rowDataUpdated fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called
3/ Calling Apply Transaction: rowDataUpdated fired, filter.onNewRowsLoaded called

breakingChangesNotes:
In CSRM, sorting a group column now applies the sort to the columns it represents.
Sorting a column which has been row grouped now applies the sort to its groups.

Any sort models which have been saved prior to this change will now behave differently, as sorted row grouped columns would have no impact previously, but now will apply the sort to the group column.

summary: [Regression] When displaying non-plain-text elements in grid cells, they're displayed at a smaller vertical offset than needed
When using SSRM storeType=full, filtering on the auto-group column only filters out its children but the group row remains displayed in the grid
moreInformation:
This is working as expected.

When using SSRM-full for row groups that aren't expanded, their children haven't been loaded. This is why applying a filter cannot filter group-level rows because their children haven't been loaded (as the group isn't expanded). This is why filtering is only supported at the lowest level (not group levels).

In order to filter group rows, please switch to using the client-side row model, which provides this functionality as standard as all child rows are loaded and can be filtered on.

summary: [Master/Detail] Allow detail-level rows to be selected
[Column Filtering] Allow filtering on aggregated group level values
[Regression] When using React with editor component, pressing ENTER, TAB, ESCAPE keys, the editor component onKeyDown event not fired
moreInformation:
This behavior isn't an AG Grid issue - it’s due the way events are captured according to the React spec, from the window object down (with events the bubbling back up from target to window). When the event reaches the grid we stop editing and as such the editor never gets a chance to get the event.

You can work around this limitation by adding a listener to the input element to trap keys that normally end the editing (ENTER/TAB/ESCAPE):
1. Open 
https://plnkr.co/edit/qWxwjc6UtFNCZJPu
2. Open dev console
3. Double-click top grid cell to start editing
4. Press ENTER/TAB/ESCAPE keys

Actual & Expected: Note in console messages showing events are fired for these keys

summary: When calling setDefaultColDef API method, column order is reset
moreInformation:
Not a bug.

When changing Column Definitions, if you DONT want to change the Column order, then set maintainColumnOrder: true

Demonstrated here:
1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/NwPVJZxCmidTB3BL
2. Reorder columns
3. Click button above grid

Actual & Expected: Column order preserved

summary: [Regression] When using React, calling setRowData causes cell values to flicker
moreInformation:
The grid is redrawing all the rows again, because React is triggering an async render operation that AG Grid is not in control of. 

You can fix this by implementing the getRowId() callback to provide unique row id values.

That way the grid knows to refresh the rows (i.e. it keeps the rows in the DOM) rather than destroy and recreate them. Note in example below cells values are updated without flicker:
https://plnkr.co/edit/xCJ0WzuYYJiStLB7

You can read about the getRowId callback here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/react-data-grid/row-ids/

summary: [Firefox] Combined filter (agMultiColumnFilter) with a vertical scrollbar also renders a horizontal scrollbar
moreInformation:
This issue is reproducible with Firefox even without using AG Grid.
 
Please open this in Firefox on a PC:
https://plnkr.co/edit/YyO1Fuf8mD9QtL97?preview
 
Please note that in Firefox there's an active horizontal scrollbar which isn't active when opening this in Chrome.
 
We've logged this issue with Firefox to address this bug:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=764076
 
Please treat this as a known issue and upgrade to a new version of Firefox once this issue is addressed.

You can work around this issue (and avoid the rendering of a horizontal scrollbar) by setting the popupParent property to allow the filter popup enough space to render itself fully:
https://plnkr.co/edit/nCL3VZNyJjSBQmy9?preview

This approach is documented here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/context-menu/#popup-parent

summary: When using JS or React, editing a cell causes the valueSetter to be called twice
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior.

The problem is the application is setting Row Data inside the valueSetter. This should not be done. It is intended that the valueSetter changes the data that the grid has, not that it updates the rowData.

If the application wants to set new rowData after an edit, then they should use Read Only Edit’s

https://www.ag-grid.com/react-data-grid/value-setters/#read-only-edit

summary: [Vue only] When providing the tabToNextCell callback through the gridOptions object and the focused cell is in edit mode, calling tabToNextCell/tabToPreviousCell which returns a non-editable cell, the grid becomes unresponsive
moreInformation:
The problem here is that the code keeps increasing the rowIndex without verifying if it’s a valid index. Custom functions should always check for a limit as shown in the Custom Keyboard Navigation example:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/keyboard-navigation/#example-custom-keyboard-navigation

Please see the code in the tabToNextCell to add this condition below: 

        const renderedRowCount = params.api.getModel().getRowCount();

        if (nextRowIndex >= renderedRowCount) {
        return null;
      } // returning null means don't navigate

We've used this code to fix the earlier plunker sample.

Follow the steps below:
1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/pQ6Mt3nvnQZcioZJ
2. Double-Click the top cell in AGE column to enter edit mode
3. Press TAB key twice
Actual & Expected: Bottom row AGE cell focused and in edit mode
4. Press TAB key again
Actual & Expected: Bottom row AGE cell exits edit mode, and remains focused

deprecationNotes:
Grid property immutableData is deprecated.
Grid callback getRowNodeId() is deprecated.

Instead implement getRowId(), and the grid will then also treat the data as immutable data automatically.

The old method getRowNodeId provided the parameter 'data' only. The callback getRowId provides a params object with the following attributes:
data -> as before
parentKeys -> if grouping, provides the keys of all parent groups
level -> if grouping, provides how many levels from the top the row is

parentKeys and level are provided for Serverside Row Model only.

moreInformation:
The reason for the delay is that the getSelectedNodes method is called every time row selection changes, which causes the grid yo be re-rendered constantly.
 
In order to avoid this delay, please make sure the call to getSelectedNodes is only made once by debouncing it as explained here:
https://ag-grid.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4403313930641-Debouncing-events-to-execute-logic-only-once-the-grid-is-settled

moreInformation:
This isn't related to AG Grid.

If you use properties without following camel case naming, your code will work, but React will still issue a warning asking developers to use camel case properties. See the links below:
https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/11315
https://deepscan.io/docs/rules/react-bad-style-obj-property

This is not something we can change, if you want to write React-compliant apps, you will need to update the style properties. Even a simple app without Ag Grid will issue this warning:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-fafs7t

summary: Missing properties providedColumnGroup, groupId in TypeScript IHeaderColumn type
moreInformation:
This wasn't an issue in AG Grid, but in the sample instead. We've updated the sample to fix this:
https://ag-grid.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402599415185-Dynamically-expanding-a-pivot-group-column

summary: [Regression] When using React, accessing a custom filter instance in onFirstDataRendered callback or via API before opening the filter via UI throws an exception
[Regression] When using autoHeight=true and setting rowBuffer property, the rows included in the rowBuffer don't get their height set until scrolled into view, causing the vertical scrollbar to jump
moreInformation:
This is expected behavior. The rows weren't rendered because they weren't fitting inside the pixel range set up by the row buffer.

The rowBuffer property value is used to create a Pixel Range with height=(rowBuffer value) multiplied by (Default Row Height). By default, rowBuffer=10 and as the default row height is 42px (for the Alpine theme), the grid will extend the vertical pixel range by 420px in both directions and then draw rows into that. 

However, when using AG Grid with dynamic and auto row height that's larger than the default height, only a subset of the rows may fit inside the pixel range as its height is based on the default row height, while the provided rows have a greater height.

For example, as described above, if rowBuffer=10, the grid will use a vertical pixel range of 420px in both directions. However, if you’re setting custom row height, or auto-height is setting a row height of 100px (instead of the default 42px), each of these two 420px pixel ranges above and below the grid will only fit 5 of these 100px rows, instead of 10 rows with default height of 42px.

This is why in order to support rows with big height values you need to increase the rowBuffer value accordingly to ensure the pixel range is large enough to fit as many of your taller rows as you'd like to render. You can also consider turning off row virtualization altogether to ensure all rows get rendered immediately.

summary: When using infinite row model or server-side row model with infinite scrolling with a large number of records (100,000s of records), scrolling down many records, clicking a grid cell doesn't focus it
moreInformation:
This is not an issue with AG Grid.

This behavior is caused by a bug in Chrome, which prevents mouse events from being registered in large divs after scrolling 2^24 (two to the power of twenty four) pixels down (16,777,216px). As the default row height in the ag-grid-alpine theme is 41px, this issue only happens for rows after row 409,200 when using this theme.

We have reported this issue with Chrome here: 
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1282946

Please vote for this item to increase its priority with the Chrome team.

summary: When setting aggFunc='min' or aggFunc='max' on a column with string or date values, the aggregation returns empty values
moreInformation:
The min/max aggregations are implemented with number values in mind. This means that date values aren't supported by the built-in min/max functions. 
 
However, you can easily implement your own aggregation functions to process dates objects and extract earliest/latest date values.
 
See this implemented with custom aggFuncs (called earliest and latest) below:
https://plnkr.co/edit/oJsz0m9rdEjFUSJx

summary: When using SSRM-partial with row autoHeight=true, calling ensureIndexVisible to scroll to a row, the grid scrolls down too little and the requested row is not displayed in the viewport
moreInformation:
Unless you've suspended row virtualization, the grid doesn't know how tall the rows are until it scrolls them into view and sizes them, at which point the row you scrolled into view (or scrolled to by calling ensureIndexVisible API) may be pushed out of view because the rows above it have larger height. 

In order to be able to scroll to a row that's in a data block that hasn't been loaded yet you need to tell the grid the total number of rows in the server-side data source. For example, you're looking at row 0 (which means the grid has retrieved from the server a block with rows 0-100) and you'd like to scroll to a row that's not been loaded yet - row 1500 for example, you need to tell the grid that there are at least 1500 rows.

In order to be able to do this you need to set the gridOptions.serverSideInitialRowCount property to the total number of rows in your data (not the loaded ones, the full number). 
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/server-side-model-configuration/#initial-scroll-position

The gridOptions.serverSideInitialRowCount property is only read at grid initialization, so you need to retrieve the total number of rows in your server dataset and set it to the grid before it's rendered. This way the vertical scrollbar is sized for this total number of rows and allows the iterative scrolling approach to work.

In the example below, I've manually set this value to the number of rows in the data - 8618. This allows to call api.ensureIndexVisible for any row index up to this number of rows.

Please enter a row number in the input above the grid, or just click the button to move to row 8600:
https://plnkr.co/edit/g6lRb3FfZYf4dFjV

summary: [Regression] When using React, returning an empty string in the cellStyle callback throws an exception and doesn't render the grid
moreInformation:
The interface for cellStyle says it should return an Object CellStyle or a function that returns CellStyle | null | undefined. The function used is returning a value (string) that doesn't match the interface above causing this exception. 

React is strict about this typing and when you return a value that's not from the type expected, an exception is thrown.

Please update the typing of the returned value to match the typing required as listed above. As this is not a bug in AG Grid, we've closed this bug as rejected.

summary: When setting style display=flex and flex-direction=column, the horizontal scrollbar is displayed unnecessarily
moreInformation:
This is not an issue with Ag Grid, the browser is displaying an empty scrollbar when overflow is set to auto. This is not an issue with Firefox or Safari, so we filed a BUG with Chromium:
https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301361

summary: [React] getReactContainerClasses() API Method no longer needed
breakingChangesNotes:
React only:

The interface method getReactContainerClasses() is no longer used on the following Custom React Components:
+) Cell Renderer
+) Cell Editor
+) Header Comp
+) Header Group Comp
+) Floating Filter Comp

This is because such components used to live inside React Portals, and this method allowed to put CSS Class onto the React Portal DIV item. However now React Portals are not used for these components, they live directly inside the grid's DOM. The React Portal DIV doesn't exist, thus there's nothing to style.

For Tooltips Components, a React Portal is still used, however there is no longer a need to put the CSS {position: absolute; pointer-events: none} onto the parent as these are now done for you. This was an oversight on our side, they should have been there all along.

summary: [React] Remove isPopup() and getPopupPosition() API methods for Custom Cell Editors
deprecationNotes:
This change applies to React only

The Cell Editor interface methods isPopup() and getPopupPosition() do not work when using the new React rendering engine (introduced as the optional ReactUI mode in AG Grid 26.0 and default rendering mode in AG Grid 27+).

Instead use colDef.cellEditorPopup and cellEditorPopupPosition.

This change was unavoidable as we moved to pure React Rendering by default in AG Grid 27. To call these methods on the Cell Editor required first creating the Cell Editor. However in React, you have to place the Component into the DOM in order to instantiate the Component, which is too late, as the results from these methods is needed to know where to place the Component in the DOM.

summary: [Regression] When using SSRM-partial and autoHeight=false, adding a new row reduces the heights of all visible rows
moreInformation:

See this shown below:
https://plnkr.co/edit/YeGphXkK2VGkGt13

summary: When using ReactUI, clicking on a grid cell removes the hovered style for the row
When using ReactUI=true and a custom cell editor with an input field firing an onBlur event, navigating away from the edited cell does not trigger the onBlur event
moreInformation:
The blur event doesn't get fired because React removes the cell editor element from the DOM before it fires the Blue event. 

We recommend using a different event to call the logic you have currently hooked onto the blur event. For example you can use getValue() (the method the grid calls) to know when editing has stopped. getValue is always called once after cell editing has come to an end.

summary: [Regression] When using automatic row height (autoHeight=true), the grid enters an infinite loop in measureHeight
[Charts] Preserve scroll position when tabbing between integrated chart menu tabs
Allow Framework Components to be registered without xxxFramework
moreInformation:
### For Angular, React and Vue Only:

Before components for frameworks, when referenced directly, used xxxFramework properties (eg cellRendererFramework). Now this is not needed, the same property as for JavaScript Components is used (eg cellRenderer can now point to a JavaScript OR React / Angular / Vue) component.

The grid inspects the component and works out if it's Plain JavaScript or using Angular / React / Vue.

### For Angular and React only:

Before when registering Components, the following was used:
components -> for JavaScript Components
frameworkComponents -> for Angular / React Components

Now all components are registered via 'components' only, ie:
components -> for JavaScript / Angular / React components.

As before, the grid works out if the framework is used.

Note - Vue Components were always registered at the Vue Component level, this has not changed.
deprecationNotes:
All xxxFramework properties are deprecated, use the xxx version instead. Eg instead of cellRendererFremwork, use cellRenderer.

Grid Option frameworkComponents is now deprecated, register all components using Grid Option components instead.

For React
Full support is present for React Functional and React Class Components. However JavaScript Functional Components are no longer supported. 

If you are using JavaScript Functions for Cell Renderers, you will need to convert these to one of the below: 
a) React Functional Components
b) React Class Components
c) JavaScript Class Components

This breaking change was necessary as there is no way for the grid to differentiate between JavaScript Functional Components and React Functional Components.
breakingChangesNotes:
JavaScript Functional Components are no longer supported. 

This means if you are using JavaScript Functions for Cell Renderers, you will need to convert these to:
a) React Functional Components, 
b) React Class Components or 
c) JavaScript Class Components. 

This breaking change was necessary as there is no way for the grid to differentiate between JavaScript Functional Components and React Functional Components.

moreInformation:
This issue is resolved in v27.0. Please upgrade to v27.0 or later to resolve this.

However, if you're still using AG Grid v26.2 in order to support Internet Explorer 11, you can work around this issue in most scenarios by setting caseSensitive: true in filterParams as shown here:
https://plnkr.co/edit/nHr4Zx7pvWJesVAB  

This workaround introduces case sensitivity to the filter items and resolves the issue. The only side effect is that if you have the same value spelled with different cases you'll have multiple set filter items (instead of a single set filter item by default) for each distinct spelling of the same value.

In other words, if you have cell values "Anton" and "anton", you'll have two set filter items to represent the two distinct spellings of "Anton". See this in the example above in the filter for COL1.

Removed the following deprecated methods from the GridApi:

 - `refreshRows`: use `refreshCells` or `redrawRows` instead
